message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest premature sexual development, and the high levels of dehydroepiandrosterone sulfate point towards an adrenal androgen excess. Among the options, only deficiency of 21β-hydroxylase can cause this excess, leading to early pubic and axillary hair growth, acne, and hypertension.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The boy’s symptoms indicate precocious puberty and among the options, only deficiency of 21β-hydroxylase can lead to early development of secondary sexual characteristics due to increased production of androgens. The other options are not associated with early puberty. Additionally, the low cortisol level suggests an adrenal insufficiency, which is usually seen in patients with 21β-hydroxylase deficiency.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest precocious puberty, and the elevated Dehydroepiandrosterone sulfate levels suggest an adrenal source. Among the options, only deficiency of 21β-hydroxylase will result in abnormal androgen production leading to precocious puberty.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest precocious puberty, and among the options, only deficiency of 21β-hydroxylase can cause this condition. The serum studies also support this diagnosis, as there is low cortisol and low deoxycorticosterone, which are both produced by the adrenal cortex. Elevated dehydroepiandrosterone sulfate suggests an adrenal source of the excess androgens.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has signs of early sexual development and high levels of androgens, suggesting precocious puberty. The low cortisol levels and high levels of deoxycorticosterone and DHEAS suggest an underlying adrenal disorder. Among the options, deficiency of 21β-hydroxylase is the most likely cause, as it is the most common cause of congenital adrenal hyperplasia and can manifest as precocious puberty.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient presents with early sexual development, acne, and increased hair growth, suggesting precocious puberty. The laboratory findings show low cortisol and deoxycorticosterone levels, which could be indicative of a congenital adrenal hyperplasia. The most likely cause is a deficiency of 21β-hydroxylase, which is the most common form of congenital adrenal hyperplasia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms, including early sexual development, greasy skin, and acne, suggest excess androgen production. The low cortisol level suggests a problem with the adrenal gland. Among the options, only deficiency of 21β-hydroxylase can cause excess androgen production and low cortisol levels.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest precocious puberty, and the elevated levels of Dehydroepiandrosterone sulfate suggest adrenal androgen excess. Among the options, deficiency of 21β-hydroxylase is the most likely cause of adrenal androgen excess leading to precocious puberty.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest precocious puberty, which can be caused by overproduction of androgens. The elevated Dehydroepiandrosterone sulfate supports this theory. Among the options, only deficiency of 21β-hydroxylase can cause an overproduction of androgens.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms suggest precocious puberty, and the elevated dehydroepiandrosterone sulfate levels suggest an adrenal origin. Among the options, only deficiency of 21β-hydroxylase is associated with elevated dehydroepiandrosterone sulfate levels and precocious puberty.
